comment.body:
I quit the news a while ago, and it's true, I'm very disconnected from the "current events". But when I discover them, I've found that really those events are pretty irrelevant to me... and irrelevant to most people. The major events e.g. human crises (war refugees etc), which require large-scale attention for humanitarian help, could be helped by those local to the crisis - which would happen, were those people not totally locked down by their news and media sources. 

I also have so much more time available to learn and grow as a person, becoming more able to be part of and help the community I live in. Media and News keep us distracted from practically everything, instigating deep stagnation of personal growth and community connections.

What do you think about reddit as a news source? I've been explaining and recommending it to friends and family as a pretty balanced, "unbiased" news source, but I've come across some things recently suggesting the boards are moderated in the interests of those running reddit (and/or moderators of subs). If not reddit, what similar sites could I recommend?

Thanks for the website link :)
<A>, for ultimate sneakiness. They won't know what's hit them, but deep down they'll feel it.
